info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-ntp-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for NTP operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2017-2019, 2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** System & Management
**Paths:** 2

get.description:
Contains ntp status info for the queried switch or router
         which includes reference identifier, reference time, stratum
         delay and other details

kod-type.description: KOD types could be any of the enumerations including INIT ACTS etc

ref-clk-src-type.description: Contains clock source type specifics eg GPS and container extensions

ip-addr.description:
IP address is the IP address of  the NTP server or
         peer

exception-code.description: Bad stat or exception code in case the 3 criteria of ip, clock and kod don't match

kod-type.description: KOD types could be any of the enumerations including INIT ACTS etc

kod-data.description: Container for KOD type eg INIT ACTS

ref-clk-src-type.description: Contains clock source type specifics eg GPS and container extensions

ref-clk-src-data.description: Container for clock data. GPS is the only source supported by Cisco currently

vrf-name.description:
VRF name is the virtual routing instance through
         which we can find the ntp server or peer

assoc-id.description: Association id is a descriptor which describes the association between two NTP entities whether client and peer or client and server

peer-reach.description: The status of the last 8 NTP packet exchanges with peers. 1 is encoded in the bitmask for a successful attempt and 0 is encoded for failure. If all the last 8 transactions with peers or messages sent to peers are successful the encoding becomes 0xff

peer-stratum.description: Stratum in which the peer exists

last-poll-time.description: The time of  the last NTP poll or update that happened in seconds. How many seconds back did the last update happen or when did the last NTP update happen ?

poll.description:
Maximum poll time of NTP in seconds expressed as a
         power of two as per model and RFC

delay.description: Round trip delay of reaching the peer and returning

offset.description: Difference in time between current switch and peer and server clock

jitter.description: Jitter in ms refers to short-term variations in frequency of components greater than 10 hz

num-events.description: Count of number of error events received from peer

peer-selection-status.description:
Status of peer selection based on the NTP selection
         algorithm

peer-authentication-status.description: Status of authentication of switch or router by peer

serv-type.description: Whether the remote NTP device is a server or peer

psw-crypto.description: Peer status word of ntp server or peer when authentication configured

kod-type.description: KOD types could be any of the enumerations including INIT ACTS etc

ref-clk-src-type.description: Contains clock source type specifics eg GPS and container extensions

exception-code.description: Bad stat or exception code in case the 3 criteria of ip, clock and kod don't match

kod-type.description: KOD types could be any of the enumerations including INIT ACTS etc

kod-data.description: Container for KOD type eg INIT ACTS

ref-clk-src-type.description: Contains clock source type specifics eg GPS and container extensions

ref-clk-src-data.description: Container for clock data. GPS is the only source supported by Cisco currently

refid.description: Reference id can either be a KOD code or a clock source or an IP address

ip-addr.description:
IP address is the IP address of  the NTP server or
         peer

vrf-name.description:
VRF name is the virtual routing instance through
         which we can find the ntp server or peer

ntp-address.description: NTP address consists of an IP address and a VRF name

sys-poll.description:
Frequency or periodicity of NTP polling in seconds
         expressed as a power of two as per model and rfc

stratum.description: How far away the current switch is in term of hops  from the primary time source of the subnet or from the root of the subnet

root-delay.description: Round trip delay with respect to the primary time server

root-disp.description: Deviation of offset with respect to time. All measurements are between the current switch and the root of the subnet

freq-drift-ppm.description: The second derivative of offset with time. In NTP version 4, this is always 0
